newFeatures.title: Revamp Earning Rules & Points Multiplier Campaigns
newFeatures.plan: Shopify & Salla: Free / Pro / GURU · Selfserve: Starter / Growth / Enterprise
newFeatures.description:
As a Gameball client

I want more advanced configuration options for earning rules and point multiplier campaigns, allowing me to include or exclude any order attributes and apply multipliers with full flexibility

So that I can create precise, targeted earning logic that matches my business model and gives me full control over how points are awarded.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
1. Earning Rules Revamp

1.1 Include/Exclude Order Attributes

  • Clients can include specific attributes from the Order API to define what qualifies for earning points.

  • Clients can exclude specific attributes from the Order API to define what cannot earn points.

  • Available attributes for include/exclude must include (but are not limited to):

    • Category

    • Collection

    • Vendor

    • Product

    • Extra: Payment Method

    • Channel (web, POS, call center)

    • Tags

    • Any field sent in the order API payload

1.2 Attribute Selection Behavior

  • If one or more attributes are added to the “Include” list, then:

    • Only attributes matching those rules earn points

    • Any attribute not matching them earns zero points

  • If attributes are added to the “Exclude” list, then:

    • Items matching those attributes earn zero points

    • All others earn points normally

1.3 Calculation Logic

  • The system evaluates:

    1. Include rules (if any)

    2. Exclude rules

    3. Standard earning calculation

  • If multiple attributes match include/exclude logic, the strictest rule applies:

    • Exclude overrides include

2. Points Multiplier Campaigns Expansion

2.1 Add All Order API Attributes

  • Clients can apply multipliers based on:

    • Quantity

    • Vendor

    • Collection

    • Category

    • Product Name

    • Payment Method

    • Channel

    • Tags

    • Custom order metadata

    • Any attribute sent in the Order API

2.2 Flexible Multiplier Conditions

  • Clients can configure:

    • Single attribute multipliers (e.g., 2X on Vendor = Nike)

    • Multi-attribute combinations (e.g., 3X for Category includes Shoes AND Payment Method = Online Payment)

    • Quantity-based multipliers (e.g., 1.5X for quantity ≥ 3)

2.3 UI Improvements

  • Attribute selection uses dropdowns populated automatically from Order API values.

  • Clients can add multiple multiplier conditions (same UX as existing rule builder).

2.4 Calculation Logic

  • Points multiplier is applied after evaluating earning rules.

  • If multiple multipliers match the order:

    • The highest multiplier is applied

3. Attributes Operators: 
3.1 Strings: 
  • Equals
  • Contains
  • Starts With -New-
3.2 Numbers
  • Equals
  • Greater Than or Equals
  • Between

newFeatures.title: Add Attribute for Total Achieved Reward Campaigns
newFeatures.plan: Shopify & Salla: Free / Pro / GURU · Selfserve: Starter / Growth / Enterprise
newFeatures.description:
As a Gameball client,
I want to have a calculated customer attribute that represents the total number of reward campaigns a customer has achieved,
So that I can use this value for segmentation, personalization, and advanced logic across different Gameball modules.

capabilities.title: Key Capabilities
items:
Acceptance Criteria:

  • A new preserved customer attribute is introduced to track the total number of achieved reward campaigns per customer.

  • The attribute automatically increments whenever a customer successfully completes and achieves a reward campaign.

  • Only successfully completed reward campaigns are counted; incomplete, failed, or disqualified campaigns are excluded.

  • Streaks Reward campaigns counts one-time not for every streak day

  • The attribute is stored and maintained by the system and does not require manual updates from the client.

  • The attribute is available as a filter in segmentation rules.

  • The attribute is available as a variable in:

    • Automations

    • Notifications

    • Communication campaigns

  • The attribute value reflects real-time or near real-time updates after a campaign is achieved.

  • Existing customer data remains unaffected, and historical achieved campaigns are correctly reflected in the calculated value.

  • The attribute follows standard naming and formatting conventions used for customer attributes.
